snippet: Insurgents from the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria posted photos on the web to support the claim that they had executed 1,700 people. If true, it would be the region’s worst mass atrocity in recent years.
abstract: Sunni Islamist militants claim to have massacred some 1,700 captive Shiite members of Iraq's security forces, posting grisly pictures of mass execution in Tikrit as evidence; action comes as militants cement control of city of Tal Afar following two days of fierce clashes with Iraqi troops; atrocity seems aimed at stoking return to all-out sectarian violence in country.

byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and ALISSA J. RUBIN
byline.contributor: Tim Arango contributed reporting from Erbil, Iraq, and Aziz Alwan from Baghdad.

lead_paragraph: Insurgents from the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria posted photos on the web to support the claim that they had executed 1,700 people. If true, it would be the region’s worst mass atrocity in recent years.

headline.print_headline: Militants Claim Mass Execution of Iraqi Forces

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Islamic State of Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
